lead_paragraph: A commission that evaluated Haiti’s presidential election said that most of the irregularities it found in first-round voting were the result of widespread ineptitude by poll workers.

headline.print_headline: The Americas; Haiti: Panel Says Election Irregularities Were Due to Incompetence, Not Fraud
headline.main: Haiti: Panel Says Election Irregularities Were Due to Incompetence, Not Fraud

snippet: A commission that evaluated Haiti’s presidential election said that most of the irregularities it found in first-round voting were the result of widespread ineptitude by poll workers.
abstract: Report on presidential election by Haiti’s Provisional Electoral Council attributes irregularities to ineptitude by poll workers rather than political tampering; confirms victory of government-backed candidate Jovenel Moise.
